Dear Ms. Klinski:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 For repeat violations, note why the previous CAP was unsuccessful.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the local office at (866) 685-0006.

ALLEGATION:
On 1/15/22, Youth A engaged in a physical altercation with another youth at the
facility. Staff member who broke up the altercation allegedly choked Youth A. No
injuries were observed, and camera footage reportedly does not support this. ID
88276881
INVESTIGATION:
This complaint was received 01/24/22 and investigated jointly with the DHHS
Specialist. The original allegations were as follows,
Youth A (14) is currently placed at Calumet Center. Supervisor 1 is a supervisor
at the facility. On 01/15/2022, Youth A had a physical altercation with another
peer at the facility. When Supervisor 1 broke up the fight he choked Youth A. It is
unknown how she was choked and was not observed marks or bruises. The
cameras at the facility were reviewed and there is no evidence Youth A was
choked. Supervisor 1 is no longer working in the area Youth A resides in.
I interviewed the Director on 01/24/22, at the facility, jointly with the DHHS
Specialist. The Director reported that she had reviewed the incident and
accompanying video and reported the allegations from Youth A’s grievance. The
Director reported that she did not witness any choking by the supervisor on video.
Supervisor 1 has been removed from contact with Youth A pending the outcome of
the investigation. When discussing the incident report, the Director reported that the
incident report noted both youths saw the nurse, but the Director said they did not.
They had been seen by medical since the incident, but for other reasons.
The video of this incident shows the group of residents and staff on the pod. Youth A
was viewed getting out of her seat and taking an item from Youth B. Staff separated
Youth A from Youth B by walking her away. Youth B went toward Youth A and the
two started exchanging punches and grabbed onto one another. The Staff tried to
separate them. Supervisor 2 and Supervisor 1 approached and also began to
separate the girls from one another. Although the incident occurred on the opposite
end of the room, and was not completely clear, it did not appear that Supervisor 1 or
2 choked Youth A during the separation. Supervisor 1 escorted Youth A to her
bedroom. Youth B was briefly physically managed by Supervisor 2 and then
escorted to her bedroom.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility, on 01/25/22, jointly with the DHHS Specialist.
Youth A reported feeling safe and had no other concerns about her placement.
Regarding this incident, Youth A reported that she had a physical altercation with a
3

peer and Supervisor 1 choked her because he thought she was fighting the staff.
Youth A said Supervisor 1 put his hand on her neck and noted they were face to
face. This reportedly occurred by the window on the pod, near the shower. Youth A
said his hand was on her neck for about four seconds, but she did not have any
trouble breathing. Youth A said she had no marks or bruises. She did not see a
nurse afterward. Youth A said that she was then restrained and taken to her
bedroom. She explained the restraint and escort as being held with her arms behind
her back. Youth A said that Supervisor 1 told her to calm down and she was able to
quickly come back out of her room without being locked in. Youth A said she has not
had any other issues like this.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility on 01/25/22. Youth B recalled the incident and
reported a consistent account as reported by Youth A and as viewed on video.
Youth B said that during the altercation, Youth A had ahold of Youth B’s hair. Youth
B was not sure how the staff and supervisors got them separated. After they were
separated, Youth B said they were each escorted to their rooms. Youth B reported
no injuries and noted she did not see the nurse. Youth B did not recall seeing
anyone get choked during the incident.
I interviewed Youth C at the facility on 01/25/22. Youth C reported that she saw the
fight between Youth A and Youth B and noted that Supervisor 1 and the Staff broke
it up. Youth C did not recall seeing anyone being choked during the incident.
I interviewed Supervisor 1, jointly with the DHHS Specialist, at the facility on
01/25/22. Supervisor 1 provided a consistent account of the incident as reviewed on
video. Supervisor 1 said he was in the hall when he got a call for security to assist.
When he got on the pod, Supervisor 1 said Youth A had ahold of someone’s hair.
Supervisor 1 said that he took ahold of Youth A’s arms from behind. He said that it
was not a full restraint hold, but he was able to secure Youth A’s arms to transport
her to her room. Supervisor 1 said that he does not like putting a female youth in a
full restraint hold to transport her if he can avoid it. Supervisor 1 denied putting his
hands on Youth A’s neck or otherwise choking Youth A. Supervisor 1 said that both
youths saw the nurse, but he could not recall which nurse they saw.
I interviewed Supervisor 2, jointly with the DHHS Specialist, at the facility on
01/25/22. Supervisor 2 reported that he was trying to talk to another resident who
was upset when he heard a “commotion.” Supervisor 2 said that Youth A and Youth
B were fighting so he called security and then tried to separate the girls. Supervisor
2 said that Supervisor 1 pulled Youth A off of Youth B because Youth A was holding
onto Youth B’s hair. Supervisor 1 then walked Youth A to her bedroom. Supervisor 2
said that he then escorted Youth B to her room. Supervisor 2 denied seeing anyone
being choked. Supervisor 2 said he only saw Supervisor 1 hold Youth A from under
her arms.
In a 02/08/22 email exchange, the Director confirmed that neither youth were seen
by the nurse for this incident on the day of, or the day after this incident.
4

Documentation reviewed as part of this investigation.
 Facility policy on Critical and Unusual Incidents.
 Unusual Incident Report Summary, completed by Supervisor 2, dated
01/15/22. The report noted that Youth A and Youth B engaged in a physical
altercation. Staff and supervisors separated the two youth and Youth A
walked into her room, while Youth B was physically managed. The report
stated, “Both residents have been examined by the Facility Nurse.”
 MiSACWIS restraint report for Youth B. Congruent with the Unusual Incident
Report Summary. Submitted 01/18/22.
 Youth Complaint/Grievance Form, completed by Youth A and dated 01/20/22.
The report by Youth A stated, “On Saturday, January 15, 2022, I was choked
by a supervisor while fighting one of my peers. Supervisor 1 by the window.”
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures regarding discipline. These shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring
agencies.
ANALYSIS: The facility is compliant with the rule as the video evidence and
the staff interviews support that Supervisor 1 did not choke
Youth A during this incident.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
INVESTIGATION:
The facility documentation reported that the two girls were seen by the facility nurse
when they were not.
5

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.159 Resident restraint.
(3) The written policy shall include all of the following:
(c) Procedures for recording restraints as an incident
report.
ANALYSIS: Both the incident report and unusual incident report summary
stated that both residents had seen the nurse when this was not
true. Neither youth had seen the nurse on the day of the incident
and neither saw the nurse the day after the incident.
Additionally, the MiSACWIS restraint incident report was not
submitted until 01/18/22, when this incident occurred 01/15/22.
The requirement is for the incident to be submitted to the
Department within 24 hours.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on the findings of this investigation, I recommend no change to the current
license status. This recommendation is contingent on the facility submitting an
acceptable corrective action plan for the noted violation.
